intro: Descurainia pinnata subsp. paysonii, commonly known as Payson's tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and cruciform petals. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a mat-forming growth habit. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a rough, hairy texture, and it produces elongated pods that contain several seeds. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and morphological traits compared to other members of the species.
